Pierre went nearer to the lamp.

Pierre read the first words of the Gospel: 'In the beginning was the Word and the Word was with God.'
Pierre went round the table.
Pierre saw a large open box filled with something.

Pierre was not at all surprised by what Pierre saw.
Pierre hoped to enter on an entirely new life quite unlike the old one.
Pierre expected everything to be unusual, even more unusual than what Pierre was seeing.
Pierre expected a skull, a coffin, the Gospel, and even more.
Pierre tried to stimulate Pierre's emotions by looking around.
Pierre kept saying to himself: 'God, death, love, the brotherhood of man.'
Pierre associated the words 'God, death, love, the brotherhood of man' with vague yet joyful ideas.
